document.heading: District of Columbia Statute of Limitations Amendment Act of 1986

history.narrative: Law 6-202, the “District of Columbia Statute of Limitations Amendment Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-510, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 25, 1986 and December 16, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 8, 1987, it was assigned Act No. 6-261 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
